hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Lull Reversal on First Post-Holiday ETF Flow Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with low holiday volume, the first significant daily net inflow (>$50M) to US Spot Bitcoin ETFs following a 3+ day period of consecutive outflows or net flows <$10M will trigger a mean-reverting price surge of +3-5% within the next 48 hours, as pent-up institutional demand overcomes the liquidity vacuum.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday periods and low-volatility neutral regimes see suppressed liquidity and muted price action. A sharp reversal in the dominant institutional flow driver (ETFs) after a period of stagnation is likely to be amplified in thin markets, creating a high-probability, short-term timing edge.
entry_conditions: US Spot Bitcoin ETF aggregate net flows <= $10M (or negative) for >= 3 consecutive trading days
On signal day, ETF net flows > +$50M (significant inflow)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price increases by +4% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price decreases by -2% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 48-hour return after signal is <= +1.0% or Sharpe ratio is negative over 50+ historical and forward-testing instances.
